content.question: The graphs of the linear functions <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown above. If <math alttext="h of x equals, f of x, plus g of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="h prime of x, equals" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="negative one half times x, plus 7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
